tool.name: browser

best_practices.practice: Always verify information from official sources
Check publication dates for currency of information

tool.when_to_use: - Researching technical topics from official documentation - Verifying facts and statistics - Finding current best practices and trends - Accessing external references and sources

tool.name: codebase_search

best_practices.practice: Search for content patterns and style guidelines in existing codebase
Look for similar content types to understand format and structure
Identify existing style guides and conventions

tool.when_to_use: - Finding examples of similar content types - Understanding existing content structure and patterns - Locating style guides and documentation standards

tool.name: read_file

best_practices.practice: Examine existing content to understand style and format
Study successful content examples for reference

tool.when_to_use: - Reviewing existing content examples - Studying documentation patterns - Understanding project-specific content requirements

tool.name: ask_followup_question

best_practices.practice: Provide specific, actionable suggestions based on research
Ask for clarification when requirements are unclear
Request additional information to ensure accuracy

tool.when_to_use: - When content requirements are ambiguous - When additional research is needed - When clarification on target audience or purpose is required

research_workflow.step: Use codebase_search to find existing content patterns
Use browser to research topic from reliable sources
Use read_file to examine existing content examples
Verify all facts before including in content
Create content based on verified information

verification_steps.step: Check all technical information against official documentation
Verify statistics and data points from authoritative sources
Cross-reference claims with multiple reliable sources
Ensure no assumptions are made without verification
Validate all external links and references
